title: Reverse Identity Theft
alt: I asked a few friends whether they'd had this happen, then looked up the popularity of their initials/names over time. Based on those numbers, it looks like there must be at least 750,000 people in the US alone who think 'Sure, that's probably my email address' on a regular basis.
transcript:
If your email address is [First initial]+[Last name]@gmail.com you gradually get to know lots of older people who have the same name patternCueball: Yes, I know it would make sense if that were your email address, but it's not.
Person on the phone: But how did you get my number?
Cueball: Your phone bill.
